org.youscope.common.table

Interface RowView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<TableEntry<?>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TemporaryRow

    public interface RowView
extends java.lang.Iterable<TableEntry<?>>
    Represents a view on a row of a graph. Does itself not contain data, and should not be passed around (pass the graph, or a copy of the graph, instead).
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

      • get

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> TableEntry<T> get(ColumnDefinition<T> columnDefinition)
                                            throws TableException,
                                                   java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the table entry corresponding to the given column definition.
        Parameters:
        columnDefinition - the definition of the column to return the entry of.
        Returns:
        The entry corresponding to the column definition.
        Throws:
        TableException - thrown if there is no entry corresponding to the definition, or if entry has different value type.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if columnDefinition is null.

      • get

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> TableEntry<? extends T> get(int column,
                                                             java.lang.Class<T> valueType)
                                                      throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                             TableException
        Returns the entry in the given column with the given value type.
        Parameters:
        column - The column of the entry.
        valueType - The value type of the entry. Must be a super-class of the actual value type.
        Returns:
        The entry at the given column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if column index is invalid.
        TableException - Thrown if entry type is incompatible.

        TableEntry<?> get(java.lang.String columnName)
           throws TableException
        Returns the entry with the given column name.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The column name of the entry.
        Returns:
        The entry at the column with the given column name.
        Throws:
        TableException - Thrown if column with the given name does not exist.

      • get

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> TableEntry<? extends T> get(java.lang.String columnName,
                                                             java.lang.Class<T> valueType)
                                                      throws TableException
        Returns the entry in the column with the given column name, having the given value type.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The column name of the entry.
        valueType - The value type of the entry. Must be a super-class of the actual value type.
        Returns:
        The entry at the column with the given column name.
        Throws:
        TableException - Thrown if entry type is incompatible, or column with the given name does not exist.

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> T getValue(ColumnDefinition<T> columnDefinition)
                                     throws TableException,
                                            java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the value of the table entry corresponding to the given column definition.
        Parameters:
        columnDefinition - the definition of the column to return the value of the entry of.
        Returns:
        The value of the entry corresponding to the column definition.
        Throws:
        TableException - thrown if there is no entry corresponding to the definition, or if entry has different value type.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if columnDefinition is null.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The value of the entry at the column with the given column name.

      • getValue

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> T getValue(int column,
                                            java.lang.Class<T> valueType)
                                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                            TableException
        Returns the value of the entry in the given column, having the given value type.
        Parameters:
        column - The column of the entry.
        valueType - The value type of the entry. Must be a super-class of the actual value type.
        Returns:
        The value of the entry at the given column.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if column index is invalid.
        TableException - Thrown if entry type is not of the given valueType.

      • getValue

        <T extends java.io.Serializable> T getValue(java.lang.String columnName,
                                            java.lang.Class<T> valueType)
                                     throws TableException
        Returns the value of the entry in the column with the given column name, having the given value type.
        Parameters:
        columnName - The column name of the entry.
        valueType - The value type of the entry. Must be a super-class of the actual value type.
        Returns:
        The value of the entry at the column with the given column name.
        Throws:
        TableException - Thrown if entry type is not of the given valueType, or if a column with the given name does not exist.
